member.name: M:ApexCharts.ApexChart`1.RemoveAnnotationAsync(System.String)
member.summary: The removeAnnotation() method can be used to delete any previously added annotations. Only annotations which are added by external methods (addPointAnnotation, addXaxisAnnotation, addYaxisAnnotation) are affected. Annotations defined in the options/config object are not affected.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.ApexChartOptions`1.Colors
member.summary: Colors for the chart's series. When all colors of the array are used, it starts from the beginning. Predefined colors are available in theme palettes

You should only provide either hex or rgb/rgba format. Color names are not accepted at the moment.
Links:
JavaScript Documentation, JavaScript Reference

member.summary: Enable different shades of color depending on the value. Accepts from 0 to 1

member.name: P:ApexCharts.PlotOptionsTreemap.Distributed
member.summary: When turned on, each series in a treemap will have it's own lowest and highest range and colors will be shaded for each series. Default value is false.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.PlotOptionsTreemap.ReverseNegativeShade
member.summary: When enabled, it will reverse the shades for negatives but keep the positive shades as it is now. An example of such use-case would be in a profit/loss chart where darker reds mean larger losses, darker greens mean larger gains.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.PlotOptionsTreemap.UseFillColorAsStroke
member.summary: When turned on, the stroke/border around the treemap cell has the same color as the cell color.

member.name: T:ApexCharts.Chart
member.summary: Main class to configure options that will be applied to the generated chart.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.Background
member.summary: Background color for the chart area. If you want to set background with css, use .apexcharts-canvas to set it.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.DefaultLocale
member.summary: defaultLocale is the preselected language that the chart should render initially and the selected locale has to be present in the locales array. Read more in the localization guide.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.Events
member.summary:
A collection of JavaScript functions to execute on specific interations with the chart. Recommendation is to use events within . Available keys are:
animationEnd, beforeMount, mounted, updated, click, mouseMove, mouseLeave, legendClick, markerClick, xAxisLabelClick, selection, dataPointSelection, dataPointMouseEnter, dataPointMouseLeave, beforeZoom, beforeResetZoom, zoomed, scrolled, brushScrolled

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.FontFamily
member.summary: Sets the font family for all the text elements of the chart. Defaults to 'Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif'

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.ForeColor
member.summary: Sets the text color for the chart. Defaults to #373d3f

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.Group
member.summary: A chart group is created to perform interactive operations at the same time in all the charts. In case you want to create synchronized charts, you will need to provide this property.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.Id
member.summary:
A chart ID is a unique identifier that will be used in calling certain ApexCharts methods. You will also need chart.id to be set in case you want to use any of the following functionalities.
brush chart
synchronized chart
Calling exec method of ApexCharts

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.OffsetX
member.summary: Sets the left offset for the whole chart.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.OffsetY
member.summary: Sets the top offset for the entire chart.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.ParentHeightOffset
member.summary: A small increment in height added to the parent of chart element.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.RedrawOnParentResize
member.summary: Re-render the chart when the element size gets changed or the size of the parent element gets changed. Useful in conditions where the chart container resizes after page reload.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.RedrawOnWindowResize
member.summary: Re-render the chart when the window in which chart is rendered gets resized. Useful when rendering chart in iframes.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.Stacked
member.summary: Enables stacked option for axis charts. Example
member.remarks: A stacked chart works only for same chart types and won't work in combo/mixed charts combinations. So, an area series combined with a column series will not work.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.StackType
member.summary: When stacked, should the stacking be percentage based or normal stacking.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.Type
member.summary: Specify the chart type

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.Width
member.summary: Width of the chart.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Chart.Height
member.summary:
Height of the chart. The default value 'auto' is calculated based on the golden ratio 1.618 which roughly translates to a 16:10 aspect ratio. Examples:
height: 400 height: '400px' height: '100%'
member.remarks: Note: If you provide a percentage value '100%', make sure to have a fixed height parent.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Tools.Download
member.summary: Show the download menu / hamburger icon in the toolbar. If you want to display a custom icon instead of hamburger icon, you can provide HTML string in this property. download: true download: '' ApexCharts has built-in support to allow exporting the chart to popular image formats like PNG or SVG and also allows exporting the chart data to a CSV file. By default, all XY charts have the toolbar enabled in them which has a hamburger icon at the top right corner. Clicking the hamburger icon opens a menu which has following options to download.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Tools.Pan
member.summary: Show the panning icon in the toolbar.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Tools.Reset
member.summary: Reset the chart data to it's initial state after zommin/zoomout/panning. If you want to display a custom icon for reset, you can provide HTML string in this property.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Tools.Selection
member.summary: Show the rectangle selection icon in the toolbar. If you want to display a custom icon for selection, you can provide HTML string in this property.
member.remarks: Make sure to also enable when showing the selection tool.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Tools.Zoom
member.summary: Show the zoom icon which is used for zooming by dragging selection on the chart area. If you want to display a custom icon for zoom, you can provide HTML string in this property.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Tools.Zoomin
member.summary: Show the zoom-in icon which zooms in 50% from the visible chart area. If you want to display a custom icon for zoom-in, you can provide HTML string in this property.

member.name: P:ApexCharts.Tools.Zoomout
member.summary: Show the zoom-out icon which zooms out 50% from the visible chart area. If you want to display a custom icon for zoom-out, you can provide HTML string in this property.

member.remarks: Known Issue: In synchronized charts, or will not update charts in sync, while will work correctly.

member.summary: etting this options takes the y-axis out of the plotting area. Much behaves like position: absolute property of CSS

member.summary: If set to true, the y-axis scales are forced to generate nice looking rounded numbers even when min/max are provided. Turn this off if you manually set min/max and want it to be unchanged.

member.summary: A non-linear scale when there is a large range of values.

member.summary: Controls the logarithmic base. Default is 10

member.name: P:ApexCharts.YAxis.Max
member.summary: The highest number to be set for the y-axis. The graph drawing beyond this number will be clipped off.
member.remarks: You can also pass a function here which should return a number.The function accepts an argument which by default is the biggest value in the y-axis.function(max) { return max }

member.name: P:ApexCharts.YAxis.Min
member.summary: The lowest number to be set for the y-axis. The graph drawing beyond this number will be clipped off.
member.remarks: You can also pass a function here which should return a number.The function accepts an argument which by default is the smallest value in the y-axis.function(min) { return min }
